author: Special Correspondent
text:
The National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL) has extended the accreditation for the laboratory of the Microbiology Department of Jipmer till 2018.

According to a press note from Jipmer, though accreditation is voluntary in India, the State Reference Laboratory (SRL) for HIV set a goal to obtain accreditation for the laboratory.

Improves quality

Accreditation improves the quality of healthcare by decreasing testing errors and hence reduces inappropriate treatment.

A team led by Jipmer Director and microbiologist S. C. Parija, Rakesh Singh, associate professor of Microbiology and SRL-in-charge of HIV laboratory, and B. N. Harish, professor and Head of Microbiology Department, was tasked with sustaining excellence at the lab.

The SRL for HIV testing was accredited by NABL on February 14, 2014, the first and only medical laboratory to be NABL-accredited in Puducherry.

The decision to extend NABL-accredited lab certification till 2018 was taken after a recent re-assessment by the NABL assessors that found the standards of HIV testing at the lab comparable to international benchmarks, the note said.
title: NABL extends accreditation for Jipmer’s lab
